arts.ttl: Liam Manning points to 'big positive' as Bristol City keep top six spot after slow start vs QPR
arts.sum: Liam Manning insists the fact that his Bristol City side have come through their games with both West Brom and QPR unbeaten is a "really big positive" despite admitting the Reds didn't manage to match their recent performance level at Loftus Road. "Not quite the performance level we've shown recently but I think to the same point, to top the week off remaining unbeaten I think is a really big positive," the head coach told Bristol Live in his post-match press conference.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on QPR 1 Bristol City 1 - Rangers hold play-off chasers to move point closer to safety
arts.sum: The attacking midfield trio of Dembele, Saito and Madsen combined well during QPR’s bright start to the game, never more so than in the build-up to Dembele’s goal, but their influence faded following the Bristol City equaliser. Harrison Ashby passed up a glorious opportunity to give Rangers the lead, poking a shot straight at Bristol City goalkeeper Max O’Leary after Kader Dembele had picked him out brilliantly.

arts.ttl: QPR 1 - 1 Bristol City live: George Earthy pulls Robins level after slow start at Loftus Road - Bristol Live
arts.sum: Hello and welcome to this afternoon's live blog as Bristol City look to stretch their winning run in the Championship to three matches against QPR at Loftus Road. While that result fired Liam Manning's side up to fifth in the Championship, they've had little time to enjoy it with the games coming thick and fast in England's second tier.

arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings as the Robins draw 1-1 with QPR at Loftus Road
arts.sum: If there was a moment that sums up Max Bird's first season at Bristol City, it was his pass to assist George Earthy's leveller at Loftus Road. Having been caught on the wrong side of the ball early in the first half, he improved as the game wore on and actually looked more effective when he was pushed to the left of defence.

arts.ttl: QPR v Bristol City player ratings
arts.sum: QPR moved to the 50-point mark by securing a 1-1 draw at home to play-off chasing Bristol City. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player. Paul Nardi: 7 Cool when called upon. Jimmy Dunne: 8 Continues to perform superbly at right-back. arts.ttl: QPR boss Cifuentes values Championship survival this season above the last Great Escape
arts.sum: “So I give a lot of value to have 50 points [this season] and big credit to the players. The west London club also found themselves bottom of the standings heading into the winter months this term, owing much to a lengthy injury list, but they are now eight points clear of the bottom three with four games left to play.

arts.ttl: ‘It looks good’ says Cifuentes after QPR draw – and boss is asked about Ronnie Edwards’ future
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes congratulated his QPR players for taking the club to the verge of Championship safety and urged them to finish the season strongly. The head coach’s aim has long been to better the 56 points Rangers managed last term as that would be seen as a sign of significant progress. arts.ttl: Play-off hopefuls Bristol City come from behind to rescue draw at QPR
arts.sum: George Earthy cancelled out Karamoko Dembele’s opener for Rangers.

arts.ttl: Bristol City predicted team vs QPR as Manning faces McCrorie and Williams call
arts.sum: While it may not feel quite as nerve-wracking as Tuesday night's clash with West Brom, Bristol City are once again in Championship action this afternoon as they travel to Loftus Road to face QPR. With George Tanner once again fit and available, there is a chance Manning could push Pring into a more advanced position, move Vyner to the left of the back three and start the 25-year-old on the right of the defensive unit.

arts.ttl: QPR v Bristol City line-ups: Four Rangers changes
arts.sum: QPR make four changes from the midweek win at Oxford, with Harrison Ashby, Yang Min-hyeok and Karamoko Dembele given starting places and Koki Saito returning from suspension. Ashby has been given the nod ahead of Morgan Fox to replace Kenneth Paal, who is out injured along with Sam Field.
